p: A&E physicians encounter large numbers of hymenopteran sting cases each year. In fact, during their lifetime, 94.5% of people are stung by wasps, honeybees, hornets, or bumble-bees, resulting in an unpleasant experience [ 17]. Insects are not prone to attack and sting humans; however, social Hymenoptera such as hornets, wasps, and bees: (i) have a massive defensive response to any threat to the colony and (ii) the evolution of the venom system in social Apidae and Vespidae appears to have further evolved to cause pain and augment the immune response in humans and other vertebrate predators [ 18].
